Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by stating that 32,400 votes were removed from Senator Perdue's vote tally live on TV, when in reality it was a correction of faulty data for one county.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it only provides clips of election night newscasts that corrected two data-entry errors, which do not prove any widespread election fraud.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the correction of the data-entry errors is evidence of election fraud, when in fact it was a simple mistake that was quickly corrected.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider the alternative explanation that the change in vote tally was due to a correction of faulty data for one county, rather than intentional election fraud.
